anns.prefix: We observed higher resistance to added fumonisin B1 (FB1) in fumonisin-producing Fusarium verticillioides than in nonproducing F. graminearum, and likewise between isolates of
anns.postfix: and Alternaria differing in production of sphinganine-analog toxins.

anns.prefix: Likewise, strong resistance to FB1 was caused by overexpression of the presumed
anns.postfix: “housekeeping” ceramide synthases CER1, CER2, and CER3, located outside the fumonisin cluster, indicating that F. verticillioides possesses a redundant set of insensitive targets as a self-resistance mechanism.

anns.prefix: Key Contribution Using a recently described fumonisin-sensitive
anns.postfix: strain, evidence has been obtained that not only one FUM cluster-encoded ceramide synthase gene (FUM18), but also CER1, CER2, and CER3 of F. verticillioides encode insensitive enzymes involved in fumonisin self-resistance.
